title: An increase in 20% in the price of a mango enables a man to purchase 4 mangoes less for ₹40. What was the prices of 15 mangoes before the increase? - Quora

response.answer_text: It can be seen from the question that due to increase in the price of mango by 20%, what was available for ₹40/- now costs ₹48/- and hence 4 mangoes that now cost ₹8/- less could be got. This means that the increased price of 4 mangoes is ₹8/-. Hence before price rise each mango would have cost: 100×2/120 =5/3 before price rise. Hence 15 mangoes would have cost him 5/3×15 =₹25/- before price rise

Key concepts: Simple Equations, %change concept Let the price of 1 mango before increase = x. With increase in 20 % price, the new price of 1 mango = 1.2x Equation can be setup as: Mangoes which can be bought from 40 Rs = 40/Price of each mango. 40/x - 40/1.2x = 4 (40/x){0.2/1.2} = 4 => 40 = 4*0.6x = 24 x => x = 40/24 =5/3 rs So price of 15 mangoes before increase = 15 x = 15 * 5/3 = 25 Rs
